001package io.cyborgcode.roa.db.hooks;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.db.service.DatabaseService;
004import java.util.Map;
005import org.apache.logging.log4j.util.TriConsumer;
006
007/**
008 * Defines a single database hook implementation to run custom logic
009 * before or after all tests in a class
010 *
011 * <p>Each {@code DbHookFlow} provides:
012 * <ul>
013 *   <li>a {@linkplain #flow() flow consumer} that accepts the {@link DatabaseService},
014 *       a shared parameters map, and the hook arguments, and</li>
015 *   <li>an {@linkplain #enumImpl() associated enum constant} identifying this hook.</li>
016 * </ul>
017 *
018 * @param <T> the enum type used to identify hook implementations
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021public interface DbHookFlow<T extends Enum<T>> {
022
023   /**
024    * Returns the executable hook logic.
025    *
026    * <p>The returned {@link TriConsumer} is invoked for each hook with:
027    * <ul>
028    *   <li>a {@link DatabaseService} instance for database operations,</li>
029    *   <li>a mutable {@link Map} into which the hook may write outputs, and</li>
030    *   <li>an array of {@link String} arguments defined on the {@code @DbHook} annotation.</li>
031    * </ul>
032    *
033    * @return a three-argument consumer executing the hook flow
034    */
035   TriConsumer<DatabaseService, Map<Object, Object>, String[]> flow();
036
037   /**
038    * Returns the enum constant that identifies this hook implementation.
039    *
040    * <p>This value is matched against the {@code type} attribute of the {@code @DbHook} annotation
041    * during reflective lookup to find the correct hook flow.
042    *
043    * @return the enum identifying this hook
044    */
045   T enumImpl();
046
047}
